output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of web design principles and practical skills to build your own websites. Continue practicing and exploring advanced techniques to become a proficient web designer!
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of web design! This course is designed for absolute beginners with no prior experience. We'll guide you through the fundamental concepts and practical skills needed to create your own beautiful and functional websites.

chapters.description: Learn about HTML's role in structuring web content. Understand basic HTML tags like headings, paragraphs, and lists. Practice writing simple HTML documents.
Explore different HTML elements such as images, links, and tables. Learn how to use attributes to modify element behavior and appearance. Practice adding images and links to your web pages.

Understand the importance of proper HTML structure for accessibility and SEO. Learn about semantic HTML5 elements like <header>, <nav>, <article>, and <footer>. Practice structuring your web pages semantically.
Learn about CSS's role in styling web content. Understand basic CSS syntax, selectors, and properties. Practice applying CSS styles to HTML elements.

Explore different CSS selectors such as element selectors, class selectors, and ID selectors. Learn about common CSS properties for text, colors, and backgrounds. Practice styling your web pages with CSS.

Understand the CSS box model and its components: content, padding, border, and margin. Learn how to control the spacing and layout of elements using the box model. Practice adjusting the box model properties of your elements.
Learn about essential web design principles such as visual hierarchy, balance, contrast, and typography. Understand how to create visually appealing and user-friendly websites.
Understand the importance of responsive web design for different devices. Learn about viewport meta tag and media queries. Practice creating responsive layouts using CSS.

Learn about web accessibility and its importance for users with disabilities. Understand basic accessibility guidelines such as providing alternative text for images and using semantic HTML. Practice making your web pages more accessible.
